Info.title: How to Install and Setup Docker
Info.desc: How to install and setup Docker on your computer.

Instructions.instruction: Run the following command in your terminal to determine what chip you have. If it says "x86_64" you have an intel chip. If it says "arm64" you have an Apple chip.
Go to Dockers [website](https://www.docker.com/products/docker-hub/) and click on the "Get Started" button.
Click on the drop-down menu of the blue button that says "Download for Mac - Apple Chip". Select the chip or operating system output in step 1.
Follow the installation prompts, it should be pretty intuitive.
Open the "Docker" app. Accept the agreement and recommended settings.
Sign up for a Docker account and complete the welcome survey afterwards.
Go to your terminal and run the following command. It it outputs something like "Docker version 26.0.0, build 2ae903e" you should be good.
You should be good after that! You can test it further by running the following command. This command will download a test image and run it in a container.
